title: Jim Brown, legendary NFL Hall of Famer and civil rights activist, dies at 87
description: Jim Brown, widely regarded as pro football’s greatest running back who ended his career early to pursue acting and civil rights activism, has died, his family announced.

title: How national Democrats helped pull off a surprise win in the Jacksonville mayoral race
description: Democrat Donna Deegan’s win in the Jacksonville mayor's race not only energized Florida Democrats, but also etched out an early draft of a potential 2024 playbook.

title: Montana banned TikTok. Creators in the state are bracing for what’s next.
description: Countless content creators in Montana will be impacted when the bill, SB 419, goes into effect in January 2024

title: Two construction workers missing after five-alarm blaze in North Carolina
description: Two construction workers are missing after a massive five-alarm blaze broke out in Charlotte, North Carolina on Thursday, according to officials.

title: Utah mom accused of poisoning husband took out $2 million in life insurance policies on him
description: A Utah woman who allegedly spiked her husband's drink with fentanyl and then wrote a children's book about grief after he died is now accused of secretly taking out nearly $2 million in life insurance policies on him.

title: As clock ticks down on debt default, GOP negotiators 'press pause'
description: Republican negotiators tasked with cutting a deal with the White House on the debt ceiling said Friday they'd paused talks with the Biden administration.

title: U.S. and allies plan to provide Ukrainian pilots with F-16 fighter jets, official says
description: The U.S. and its allies plan to provide F-16 fighter jets to Ukraine — although the planes may not necessarily come directly from the U.S..

title: Georgia prosecutor indicates charges in Trump election probe could come in early August
description: Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis has asked the chief judge of the courthouse not to schedule in person trials or hearings the weeks of Aug. 7 and 14.

title: CDC reports another death linked to recalled eyedrops, as cases of bacterial infection rise to 81
description: Contaminated eyedrops are linked to at least 81 cases of drug-resistant bacterial infections, the CDC reported Friday. Four people have died and 14 have been blinded.

title: Twitter accuses Microsoft of misusing its data, foreshadowing a fight over AI
description: SAN FRANCISCO — A lawyer for Twitter owner Elon Musk accused Microsoft of misusing the service’s data and demanded an audit from the software giant.

title: Shop latest tech and services: Pet communicator, prepped meals
description: USA Today tech+life columnist Jennifer Jolly shares new cool tech gadgets and services, including a way for pets to communicate, pre-made meals, a phone mount that enables the camera to track you, and more.

title: D.C. police lieutenant indicted with tipping off Proud Boy Enrique Tarrio about arrest
description: A Washington, D.C., police lieutenant was indicted this week, charged with tipping off Proud Boy Enrique Tarrio about a warrant for his arrest before Jan. 6.

title: Jimmie Allen apologizes to pregnant wife for 'humiliating' affair amid sexual assault allegations
description: Jimmie Allen publicly apologized to his estranged and pregnant wife, Alexis, for “humiliating” her with his affair.

title: Why concertgoers are calling for stricter etiquette during live shows
description: As packed stadium concerts return for the first time since the Covid-19 pandemic, some concertgoers are noticing a difference in the crowds around them, leading to unpleasant or even frightening experiences. NBC News’ Kalhan Rosenblatt explains what concertgoers say they’re experiencing at sold out shows and how it’s impacting calls for stricter concert etiquette.

title: Zelenskyy to join G-7 leaders in Japan as summit focuses on Russia's war
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will make an in-person appearance at the Group of Seven summit in Hiroshima, Japan this weekend as President Joe Biden and allies discuss new sanctions against Russia.

title: Michigan 13-year-old who used a slingshot to save his  sister says he ‘was just lucky’
description: A 13-year-old Michigan boy who used a slingshot to save his 8-year-old sister from abduction said he was “freaking out” and simply reached for something that could stop the attack.
